google_play_reviews.content: I have been looking for an app that would remind me of a missed messenger. This works great. Also reminds me of calendar misses.
It is very unstable, which is a shame, as when it is working it works well.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Make sure you've allowed autostart for the application in the xiaomi rom security settings. Also if you want to have exact reminders enable "Keep device awake" option in the advanced settings of the Missed Notifications Reminder app (top right corner to activate)

google_play_reviews.content: Awsome app, works exactly as discribed!!!
Work exactly what it said, great job, it helps a lot for the phone without led notifications

No more "you didn't get my call?" or "why didn't you answer my text?" Perfect for old folks like myself who don't keep their phones attached to their hands 24/7! For those having trouble setting it up, you need to figure out which app post the notification you want repeated. There are some tools available (Notification History apps) or, on Oreo+, examining the original notification should help determine its origin.
Very good app. One more star if I can be helped with getting the 'Do not remind while phone call is active' setting to work. Reminders continue during Viber calls on my Nokia 3.
Works well on Huawei Mate 20 Pro running Android 9 Pie- after setting it up correctly.  Nice to have the reminders back again, pity it isnt a built in function.

Just installed  on my  moto E4 Plus   cant get it to work at  all. I would gladly  pay  for working app like this .  Interface very confusing  have  a hundreds  unknown   apps to be notified about I need only two  texts and  phone calls. I guess  I will have to give it some time.
Vibrations go crazy on my phone. I fully understand how to use the custom vibration setting. There should be preset vibrations. Android One, Xiaomi Mi A2 Lite.
doesn't do anything on my moto e5. Android

Liked this app more than another that is more popular.  Generally it works though as with any app, there are hiccups.  I have to pop into the app and reset things as sometimes the notifications just stop working for whatever reason.  Still more reliable and simpler to deal with than the other app.  It's updated quite often as well.  Tonight I did discover Notification Reminder in my S9.  It's under Accessibility in Settings. So notification reminders came with my S9.  Not sure how I missed this when I was googling missed notification reminders.
Great! But I wish the vibrate option defaulted to off with some type of announcement about it. It took me a while to figure out what was causing that and driving me nuts in the process.
helpfully
This app has saved me from missing tons of meetings!
The app is not working on my device even if it is already set on auto start, does not have any battery restrictions, not on DND, and not on silent mode. Please help me with my issue. Thank you.

I installed it 2 days ago. It only worked for one evening, a few hours, but hasn't worked since. I have checked the settings a dozen times but it doesn't work. It's a pity cause it could be very useful.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: On xiaomi devices you should explicitly allow app autostart

google_play_reviews.content: seems to do the job at the moment. could do with a 24hour timer though for alert times.
It just works, no extra pop-ups or adds. Thank you so much!

Just installed it, it seems to work but the repeat notification sounds are much too quiet, much quieter than my phones initial notification alert. I'm not sure if I will hear the apps noise in the night time when I need it to wake me up.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: It is possible to select another sound in the advanced app settings

google_play_reviews.content: It works flawless for all apps.  You will need to find the exact service /app. For google assistant reminder  Google : com.google.andriod.googlequicksearchbox Required search option in manage app section

Pixel 3 user here. I was upset that there was not built in notification reminder in the Pixel 3 (pretty lame on their end). I was glad to see this app. For sure it does miss reminders on text messages (it generally works but is inconsistent) where it won't remind repeatedly, which is my setting. I have it in vibrate mode now (which is most of the time for me) and it hasn't worked for several text messages, which two different people. Eugene perhaps there is an advanced setting I'm missing or just a glitch every now and then?...It's free and generally works, so how could I complain. It does take some testing out as there are lots of settings. Since there was no built in notification reminder in the Pixel 3 it would force me to check my phone often as there is no way to hear the vibrate on the Pixel 3 even when set to strongest. With this reminder I don't have to check rather I get a reminder, which is the way is should have been (and be so reliant and focused on that screen)! However, as stated it is not 100% work with the text messages (which is what I use this app for) but darn near close.
Good application working as expected
google_play_reviews.replyContent: On MIUI you need to allow app autostart explicitly. It should be done in MIUI security settings

google_play_reviews.content: Love it. Does exactly what it says.

I installed the app to get missed Messages and Phone notification reminders. The app works perfectly with Messages, but does not supply any reminders for voicemail and missed call notifications, which are the two phone reminders I most want and have tested. The phone is a Moto G5 Plus running Android 8.1 and the standard Google Messages and Phone apps. I hope there is some fix for this problem. If the phone reminders worked, my rating would be 5 stars.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Thanks for the feedback.

You should find the apps responsible for missed calls and voice mail notifications. It may be com.android.dialer or contacts app for example

google_play_reviews.content: does exactly as advertised, very easy to use
This app works very well but I have not found what setting to use on an LG G6 to remind me for voicemail notifications. Works great for missed calls and text messages.

Exactly what I wanted and needed because my Droid turbo 2 doesn't have this feature. Downloaded installed and ran a test. Received a notification every minute and let it run for 5 minutes although I have it set to forever.
Did exactly what I wanted with little set up, very happy! Thanks Eugene!
Love the app. Has made my wife very happy that I remember to respond now. Only suggestion would be addition of scheduling for days of week so I can disable on the weekend.

I use this on my Moto E4 and it works great. I'm a fan of open source software because it's typically good quality and doesn't have ads, and this is no exception. Simple, no frills but has some useful advanced settings.    I wanted it to notify me of missed text messages and phone calls so I'm having it monitor "Messages" and "Phone" apps. I think choosing the correct apps to monitor is something some users will have trouble with, but some experimentation and testing to ensure I had the correct ones is all it took.

Seems to work well unless "Do Not Disturb" is on. Android version in use is 9. Override to work with DND doesn't seem to work. I've been testing it with an app from Wyze that posts notification of camera motion. If DND is off and motion is detected by the camera, both the Wyze app and this one show as being recently used under App notifications. If DND is on and the camera detects motion, the Wyze app shows as being recently used but this one doesn't show as being used during the event.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
By default app respects DND mode. You may change the behaviour in the app advanced settings.
UPD: maybe you should adjust Android system MNR notifications settings to allow MNR to show notifications in the DND mode.

google_play_reviews.content: Excellent app, does exactly what it claims to do! No more sleeping through important text messages!

Installed on my Huawei P20. Didn't work at first, but after a restart it seemed to be ok, but a day later it was erratic. Sometimes it will give a notification, sometimes it won't, sometimes it will give a notification after a minute, then no more, or just give them at random intervals, even though I've set them for every minute and infinite times. The interface/options could be a bit easier to use, but works ok if you take your time and you know what you're looking for. Going to uninstall it as it doesn't do what I wanted. Not sure if it's just because of my phones make or model. ******UPDATED***** Having messed around with the settings I've finally got the app to work. Huawei have a lot of 'hidden' settings, and I'm not really sure what made the difference, but it now seems to be working correctly.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Huawei phones have additional settings which prevent app to wake the phone.
Try this:
Turn off power saving mode
Turn off "Manage automatically" option in "Settings / Battery / Launch
Grant all permissions to MNR app (background work, autostart, etc)
In the advanced settings of the MNR app select "Keep device awake"

google_play_reviews.content: Didn't work.
Exactly what I needed, one of a kind, if you miss a notification now you can make it beep at certain intervals so you won't miss the notification from just about any app, many options, love it.
Lately it's been launching by it self when no calls emails or anything. It just pops up on my notification bar then plays a sound. I have to close it.
Love it!!  Perfect for audibly reminding me I missed something incoming on my phone.  I have it set up to remind me of missed calls, texts, emails, and voicemails.  Works flawlessly so far.
Great app!
This is a great app. I had given up on ever finding an app that would do calls, sms and email until a friend told me about "Missed Notifications Reminder. Thank You, Eugene
Nice application. In my Moto G5/Android 7 the Gmail notifications do not repeat (only 1 time). Missed calls work right (all 5 notifications show).

Superb..i never expect that this app will run in android oreo without any issue of battery optimization and it done verywell..no interruption & it works perfectly. Maybe you can also include battery notification alarm monitoring especially when phone is fully charge. Im looking for this in the near future update.thank you

This is a must specially for units like Nokia 7 Plus that doesn't have a notification light. An extremely necessary app that just works. Just don't forget to exempt it from any task or background killing job and you're good to go.
Great app been searching for something like this for quite a while and I've finally found it There's even an option to bypass silent and don't disturb

Love this app and using it for quite a while. One thing is that recent update to Android 9 Pie on Pixel 2XL caused some issues with notifications not working until using fingerprint to wake up the phone even with app excluded from the battery optimization and background data allowed. Once I wake up the phone, they come through immediately. Changed advanced setting to keep phone awake all the time and that seems to help. Not sure I like having to do that as worried about battery life! May try a factory reset and then see if things work better. Or maybe the app just needs to be updated/optimized for Pie?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback. "Keep device awake" option works only when there are notifications to remind. In other cases app doesn't keep any wake locks. But please monitor your battery stats to make sure app doesn't drain battery to much.

google_play_reviews.content:
It took me a while to find which app to include for phone call 
notifications on an LG G7 - it turns out to be the Contacts app from LG, 
and make sure that it is also set to notify (mine wasn't). This app does 
the job perfectly, if all you need are those recurring chimes to let you 
know you missed something.

This app is genius! I use an LG G5 Canadian with low vision, and I'm always 
surprised by the lack of accessibility featres phones have. They are 
minimal at best, and I am always looking for apps to implement such basic 
features. Thank you for this, always being in loud places, it's difficult 
to hear my phone sometimes, and this works perfect. Thankyou

There is no option to attach a sound from a file or even from the phone 
ringtones.Only internal phone notification sound,which in my case are very 
short and i missed sometimes to hear it.Please,fix this inconvenience!
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Thank you for the feedback

The custom ringtones should be placed into Notifications folder of the external storage root. Also you should grant external storage permission to the MNR app

https://android.gadgethacks.com/how-to/android-basics-add-your-own-ringtones-notification-sounds-0169520/

This app has been doing just what I want it to do, thank you. Reminds me

Works perfectly, but you need to adjust the internal settings depending on 
your device to get it to actually work. For the Samsung Galaxy S6, you need 
to set the app to keep the device awake, and turn off battery optimization, 
otherwise you won't receive the reminder notifications at all.
Does exactly what I needed to do thank you for this app

It's a great app, but sometimes it randomly stops working and I haven't 
figured why yet.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: That may happen because of the battery optimization and frequent device wakeups. You may try to enable "Keep device awake" option which is available in the advanced app settings.

google_play_reviews.content:

Free, open source, a developer coding it out of passion, and doing it great.
